quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Born Anna Mary Robertson in 1860, this famous centenarian began painting in her 70s when arthritis caused her embroidering skills to deteriorate.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grandma Moses

questions.question: Were Tommy DeSimone, Henry Hill, or Jimmy Burke ever made members of the Mafia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Mob lawyer Frank Ragano claimed that this Florida mob boss was involved in JFKs assassination.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santo Trafficante Jr.

questions.question: What famous American musician, known for his trademark scarves, was born Steven Victor Tallarico in New York, NY in 1948?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Tyler

questions.question: This actor starred in over 200 movies in his career from 1931-1989, usually playing bit parts. His more notable parts include the voice of the carnival barker in Pinocchio and his portrayal of a used car salesman in the movie Detour.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Brodie

questions.question: Stephen King published several short novels, such as Rage, The Long Walk, and Roadwork under this pen name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Bachman

questions.question: Mobster Tommy DeSimone attempted to rape Henry Hills wife, Karen Hill, while Henry Hill was in prison. Who was Karen having an affair with at the time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Vario

questions.question: What 1977 sci-fi classic is one of the few films both written and directed by Steven Spielberg?

options.text: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.question: Mickey Featherstone, member of  an organized crime gang the Westies, fled to Canada to avoid being drafted into Vietnam.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What 1984 hit single from the movie The Woman in Red earned Stevie Wonder an Academy Award for Best Original Song?

options.text: I Just Called to Say I Love You
You Are the Sunshine of My Life
From the Bottom of My Heart

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Just Called to Say I Love You

questions.question: Stephen Cranes war novel The Red Badge of Courage is set during this war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Civil War

questions.question: Robert De Niros role in Casino was based on the real life gangster Benjamin Bugsy Siegel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Sonny Black of the Bonano family murdered Sonny Red who also belonged to the Bonano family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This 19th century womens right activist was born in England in 1853. She was a poet,  a writer and a leader in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. She was also active in the Republican Party in the state of Utah.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruth May Fox

questions.question: What actor is not correctly paired with the movie in which he starred?

options.text: Steve Martin  - Father of the Bride

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Seagal - The Delta Force

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Plays and Playwright
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who penned the plays The Rivals, The School for Scandal, Pizarro and The Critic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Sheridan

questions.question: Who wrote the plays Pericles Prince of Tyre, Cymbeline and Titus Andronicus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shakespeare

questions.question: Hedda Gabler, The Wild Duck, An Enemy of the People and Ghosts are plays written by this playwright.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heinrich Ibsen

questions.question: What Greek mythical hero did American bodybuilder and actor Steve Reeves portray in a 1958 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hercules

questions.question: The Killer, A Stroll in the Air, Rhinoceros and Hunger and Thirst are plays by this dramatist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eugene Ionesco

questions.question: Volpone, The Alchemist and Sejanus are plays by this dramatist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Jonson

questions.question: What late-night NBC talk show was hosted by Steve Allen from 1954 to 1957?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tonight Show

questions.question: In 1990, rock drummer Steve Adler was fired from this band because he was unable to perform well during the recording session of the song Civil War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guns N Roses

questions.question: What playwright is the author of The Misanthrope, The Miser, Tartuffe and The School for Wives?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean-Baptiste Poquelin

questions.question: Name the author of the plays Cyrano de Bergerac, Les Romanesques, Chantecler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmond Rostand

questions.question: What playwright is the author of The Way of the World, The Mourning Bride and Love for Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Congreve

questions.question: Who is the author of the plays Nathan the Wise, The Education of Mankind, The Freethinker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gotthold Lessing

questions.question: What playwright penned Waiting for Lefty, Golden Boy, Till the Day I Die and Awake and Sing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clifford Odets

questions.question: What actor won a Golden Globe for the leading role of Michael Scott in the American adaptation of the British series The Office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Carell

questions.question: What playwright wrote Tambourlaine, Dido and Edward II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Marlowe

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Author and Plays
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Joseph Conrad, the author of the popular novel Heart of Darkness, is regarded as one of the greatest novelists in the English language, although he did not learn to speak English fluently until he was in his twenties. What was his native language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polish

questions.question: US Senator Joseph McCarthy gained national attention and began his anti-communist pursuits with a famous speech delivered on this day in 1950.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lincoln Day

questions.question: What was Joe DiMaggios uniform number retired by the Yankees in 1952?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: In a famous statement from his first inaugural address, President Roosevelt said that this was the only thing Americans had to fear.

options.text: too much government intervention in the economy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fear itself

questions.question: Who is the author of the plays Oedipe, Eriphile, Mahomet and Naine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Joseph Haydn, often called the Father of the Symphony, was one of the most prominent composers of this period.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Classical period

questions.question: What 18th-century British theologian, natural philosopher and educator is credited with the discovery of oxygen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Priestly

questions.question: What novel by Joseph Heller is a sequel to Catch-22 and revisits some characters of the original, including Yossarian and Milo Minderbinder?

options.text: Portrait of an Artist, as an Old Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Closing Time

questions.question: Waiting for Godot, Krapps Last Tape, Happy Days, Catastrophe are some of the plays written by this playwright.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Beckett

questions.question: What was the goal of Roosevelts New Deal program?

options.text: start government programs that would help the economy recover
provide relief to people too poor to adequately meet the basic necessities of life.
make reforms that would improve society and the economy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: At the start of World War II, Joseph P. Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the prominent political clan, served as the United States Ambassador to this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The United Kingdom

questions.question: In 1939, Soviet leader Josef Stalin signed a non-aggression pact with Nazi Germany which was violated when Germany invaded the Soviet Union during WWII. What was the code name for this invasion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Barbarossa

questions.question: What British physicist was awarded the Nobel Prize for the discovery of the electron and his work on the conduction of electricity in gases?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph John Thomson

questions.question: The Public Works Administration (PWA), that was created as part of the New Deal program, attempted to improve the economy by which of the following?

options.text: allowing banks to give low interest rates on loans for construction projects
hiring many unemployed people to build schools, roads, etc.
reducing the amount of government money spent on infrastructure

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hiring many unemployed people to build schools, roads, etc.

questions.question: Who recorded the song We Didnt Start the Fire that makes reference to headline events and mentions Joe DiMaggio, Josef Stalin and Joseph McCarthy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Joel

quizzes.title: History Quiz: George W. Bush and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bush, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: George W. Bush, who became U.S. President in 2001, was born in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Haven, Connecticut, USA

questions.question: Which of these was created by Roosevelt to insure that the stock market was properly regulated?

options.text: Investigative branch of the Treasury Department
financial and securities branch of the Federal Bureau of Investigation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Securities and Exchange Commission

questions.question: After the 2000 presidential elections, Richard B. Cheney became U.S. Vice President under President George W. Bush.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: U.S. President George W. Bush was the first Governor in Texas that was elected to two 4-year terms in a row.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following US population groups was LEAST likely to support Roosevelt and the New Deal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: upper middle class whites

questions.question: In 2004, George W. Bush was reelected as which U.S. President in succession?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 43rd president

questions.question: Why did many people criticise the Agricultural Adjustment Act (AAA) of 1933?

options.text: Gave aid only to Caucasian farmers
Paid farmers to grow less than previously
Gave all farmers very large subsidies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paid farmers to grow less than previously

questions.question: President Roosevelt skillfully communicated with the American people through which of the following?

options.text: use of television for the first time in US politics
frequent train trips throughout the nation in which he spoke at many gatherings
weekly newspaper column called Why a New deal?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: radio fireside chats

questions.question: Which of these was the tallest U.S. President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: In 1968 George W. Bush obtained a bachelor’s degree in history from which university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yale University

questions.question: In 2002, U.S. President  George W. Bush told British Prime Minister Tony Blair that the problem with the French is that they dont have a word for entrepreneur.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Although it did not happen, many Americans feared that the Great Depression would greatly increase the power of this political party.

options.text: The Communist Party of the USA

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Communist Party of the USA

questions.question: An act of terrorism totally outside the bounds of international law and diplomatic tradition, a crisis that calls for firmness and restraint. is a quote by U. S. President George W. Bush.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1975, U.S. President George W. Bush received a masters degree in business administration from which university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvard Business School

questions.question: U. S. President George W. Bush is the son of George H. W. Bush, who served as U.S. President from 1989 to 1993. However, who were the first father and son, who both served as U. S. Presidents?

options.text: John Adams and John Quincy Adams
Theodore Roosevelt and Franklin D. Roosevelt
William Henry Harrison and Benjamin Harrison

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams and John Quincy Adams

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: George Washington and President
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mary, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year was George Washington elected president?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1789

questions.question: George Washington was related to which other US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: Where was George Washington born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: George Washington was related to  which King of England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Edward III

questions.question: What is the meaning of the very popular name Mark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warlike

questions.question: What was George Washingtons first occupation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land Surveyor

questions.question: Was George Washington assassinated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: How many children did George Washington have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None

questions.question: Maria or Mary is probably the most popular name around the world. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bitterness

questions.question: What was the name of George Washingtons wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha  Dandridge Custice

questions.question: Which of the following did George Washington not accomplish?

options.text: Established Department of State, War, and Treasury
Established office of Postmaster General, Established the Census

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alien and Sedition Acts

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding George Washingtons teeth by the time he was inaugurated as president?

options.text: He had a full set of natural teeth.
He had lower teeth, upper wooden dentures.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had one tooth remaining.

questions.question: Mount Vernon was built for which of the following reasons?

options.text: to serve as headquarters for the Virginia Militia.
to serve as headquarters for George Washington after he became president
to serve as headquarters for the Continental Army

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: George Washington was of small to medium stature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: George Washington served in both the Virginia Militia and the Continental Army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Meaning and Names
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the song recorded by Chicago in 1975 in memory of Harry S. Truman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Truman

questions.question: Peter is quite a common name around the world with many variations. What is its meaning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rock

questions.question: During the 1952 Presidential campaign, then exiting President Harry Truman had a nickname for Presidential candidate Estes Kefauver whom he disliked and distrusted. What was that nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cow fever

questions.question: Harry and Bess Truman were he first senior citizens to receive medicare cards. They received them in the mid-60s from then President LBJ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This former President died exactly 34 years following President Trumans death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gerald Ford

questions.question: Ann, Anne, Annabel, Anita are names derived from the Latin name Anna. What does this name mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gracious

questions.question: What is the meaning of the very common name John?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: God is gracious

questions.question: What does the name Steven or Stephen mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crown

questions.question: The names Christina, Christoper and their derivatives all come from the name of Christ. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Messiah

questions.question: In the television show The Simpsons, Harry Truman is on the million dollar bill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name George which has variants in dozens of languages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Farmer

questions.question: What is the meaning of the name Natalie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Born at Christmas

questions.question: How old was Harry Trumans wife, Bess Truman, when she died in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 97

questions.question: Alben Barkley served as  Vice President under Harry S. Truman from 1949-1953.  Who served as Trumans Vice President from 1945-1949?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: no one

questions.question: The names Nicole, Niki, Nicolas come from the old name Nicholas. What is the meaning of this name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victory of the people
